DOC.brief_summary: A prospective , randomize , control single-center clinical Study design evaluate Physician Preference relate use SurgiQuest AirSeal® Insufflation System ( AIS ) low vs. high pressure Management pneumoperitoneum . Subjects randomize 1:1 treatment device control ratio one two ( 2 ) different study arm : 1 . AIS insufflation pressure target 9mmHg ±1mmHg ; 2 . AIS insufflation pressure target 15mmHg ±1mmHg .
DOC.brief_title: Pneumoperitoneum Management With SurgiQuest AirSeal® Low vs. Higher Pressure
DOC.detailed_description: The study design powered demonstrate superiority AIS low pressure vs. high pressure single key effectiveness measure : Incidence shoulder pain . Patients randomize 1:1 either AIS insufflation pressure target 9mmHg ±1mmHg AIS insufflation target pressure 15mmHg ±1mmHg . Secondary outcome measure include severity shoulder pain measure use VAS scale medication use , length hospital stay , aspects anesthesia management include end tidal CO2 frequency adverse event . These outcome evaluate controlled population undergo laparoscopic surgery .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Pediatric subject ( < 21 year age ) 2 . > 20 kg weight ; 3 . Capable willing provide parental Informed Consent patient Assent ; 4 . Acceptable candidate laparoscopic surgery ; 1 . Active cutaneous infection inflammation ; 2 . Preexisting immunodeficiency disorder and/or chronic use systemic steroid ; 3 . Uncontrolled diabetes mellitus 4 . Known , significant history bleed diathesis , coagulopathy , von Willebrand 's disease current platelet count < 100,000 cells/mm3 , baseline INR ( international normalize ratio ) ≥1.8 , fibrinogen level le 150 mg/dl ( receive fibrinolytic agent within prior 24 hour ) ; 5 . Severe coexist morbidity life expectancy le 30 day ; 6 . Currently involve investigational clinical Studies ; 7 . Significant anemia hemoglobin level le 10 g/dL hematocrit le 30 % ; 8 . Females pregnant , plan become pregnant within 3 month procedure , lactate ; 9 . Extreme morbid obesity ( BMI great 45 kg/m2 ) 10 . Patients present Ascites
